channel.title: Price of computers
channel.description:
i've noticed that over the last few years the price of computers hasn't really decreased. a new laptop with the same specs as the laptop i got in 2007 costs pretty much the same amount, but i'd have to pay 5x more to get the same laptop in 2003.
is technology being improved in ways which are not really specified in the specs given by computer stores? or is it because of the recession? are computer stores deciding on prices together to scam us? or is it simply that technology can't follow the trend of decreasing prices anymore?

item.title: Price of computers
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

yeah, seems laptops dont drop that much

Read full topic

item.title: Price of computers
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I tend to agree with the thread starter somewhat. I bought a laptop with a core2duo, 2gb RAM, 250gb SATA hd, and a GeForce 8600M almost 3 years ago for a crazy $1300 dollars, which recently broke and to get the same laptop today I’d still have to pay $700+, which is ridiculous I think. Although it might just be laptops, because building computers is still as cheap as it ever was I believe.

Read full topic

item.title: Price of computers
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

[quote=“the bank, post:10, topic:338105”][quote author=la­wl link=topic=434501.msg3190687#msg3190687 date=1272220113]
i disagree completely. i bought 1gb of ddr2 ram in 2006 for $130

now it would cost about $15
[/quote]That’s due to DDR2 being obsolete.[/quote]
not really, it dropped a lot even in a year
and people still use ddr2 :\

Read full topic

item.title: Price of computers
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

Fat_Cookies, that graph is Calculations per second per $1000 compared compared to the year. That doesnt show moores law.

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:5, topic:338105”]Welcome to moores law
[img]http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/c/c5/PPTMooresLawai.jpg[/img

This trend that every two years the number of transistors in a microchip doubles has been true forever. It is also closely related the computing power: price ratio which shows raw computing power has increased and got cheaper at a rapid rate.[/quote]

Quoted for evidence.

Read full topic

um, i think you read that graph wrong mr man, how many transistors does a tube have

item.title: Price of computers
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

yeah, like i said

xx matty xx:

i’ve noticed that over the last few years the price of computers hasn’t really decreased. a new laptop with the same specs as the laptop i got in 2007 costs pretty much the same amount, but i’d have to pay 5x more to get the same laptop in 2003.

between 2003 (or 2004, in your case) and now, the price has dropped a shit load. but between 2007 and now, the price has hardly dropped at all compared to before. in 1995 my laptop with 8mb RAM cost a fair amount, then in 2000 you wouldn’t use an 8mb laptop if it was going for £10.

Read full topic

item.title: Price of computers
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

You mad?

My mother bought a laptop in 2004, some acer shit with like 2GB ram and a single core 3.6ghz processor for around £400.

Earlier this year she bought a Toshiba laptop with a dual core 2.4ghz processor and 4gb ram for £320.

Read full topic
